title: Moon Valley (Pilea Mollis/Pilea Involucrata) - Basic Information
content: An evergreen perennial to 30cm, with deep bronze-purple, toothed, ovate leaves with strongly puckered surfaces, the margins often light green.  An ideal plant for terrariums and bottle gardens

title: Moon Valley (Pilea Mollis/Pilea Involucrata) - Size
content: Ultimate Height: 0.1 to 0.5 Metres; Ultimate Spread: 0.1 to 0.5 Metres; Time to Ultime Height: 2 to 5 years

title: Moon Valley (Pilea Mollis/Pilea Involucrata) - Growing Conditions
content: Soil for this plant: Loam (Common houseplant soil), Chalk, Sand; Moisture: Moist but well-drained; pH Value: Neutral, Acide, Alkaline

title: Moon Valley (Pilea Mollis/Pilea Involucrata) - Position
content: Aspect: South-facing or East-facing; Partial shade

title: Moon Valley (Pilea Mollis/Pilea Involucrata) - Cultivation
content: Grow under glass or in a frost-free enviroment. Requires high humidity, branches become woody at base.

title: Moon Valley (Pilea Mollis/Pilea Involucrata) - Propagation
content: Propagate by seed, by division or detatch rosettes in spring

title: Moon Valley (Pilea Mollis/Pilea Involucrata) - Diseases
content: May be susceptible to Powdery Mildews
